origami_tools.Geometry package

Submodules

origami_tools.Geometry.line module

class origami_tools.Geometry.line.Line(point1, point2, dashed=False, dash_length=6, dash_ratio=0.5)

Bases: Shape

A class representing a line defined by two points.

angles_with(other, intersection=None)

Compute the two possible angles between self and another Line.

If an intersection point is provided, the direction vectors are aligned accordingly so that angles are oriented from the intersection. This helps determine the ‘left’ and ‘right’ angular difference around the intersection.

Returns two angles in radians, always in the range [0, 2π).

Return type:

list[float | int]

as_homogeneous()
as_svg(color='black', opacity=1, width=1, fill='none', origin=[0, 0])
coefficients()

Return the equation of the line in the form Ax + By + C = 0.

copy()

Create a copy of the line.

dash_length: float = 6
dash_ratio: float = 0.5
dashed: bool = False
direction_vect()

Calculate the direction vector of the line.

find_lines_near_point(point, lines)

Find the two lines that are nearest to a point. Returns the indices of the two nearest lines.

classmethod from_angle(point, angle, length)

Create a line from a point and an angle.

classmethod from_dir(point, direction)

Create a line from a point and a direction vector.

classmethod from_point_normal(point, normal, length=5)

Create a line from a point and a normal vector.

get_line_dashed(dash_length=None, dash_ratio=None)

Generate a dashed version of the line, starting with a visible dash, and including dashes at both endpoints even if partial.

has_point(point)

Check if a given point lies on the line segment.

Conditions: - Must be within the bounding box of the segment (with tolerance). - Must be colinear with the segment’s direction vector.

Return type:

bool

Calculate the intersection of two lines.

Check if the line is dashed.

class origami_tools.Geometry.line.MultiLine(points, dashed=False, dash_length=6, dash_ratio=0.5, break_points=<factory>)

Bases: Line

add_line(line)

Add a line to the MultiLine. return -1 if the line is added at the end, 0 if it is added at the beginning.

break_points: list[Point]
direction_vect()

Calculate the direction vector of the line.

classmethod from_lines(lines)

Create a MultiLine from a list of Line objects. The lines are connected if their endpoints match.

Parameters:

lines (list[Line]) – List of Line objects to be connected.

Returns:

MultiLine or None if the connection fails.

class origami_tools.Geometry.surface.Polygon(points, n_points=0)

Bases: Surface

A class representing a polygon defined by its vertices.

as_svg(color='black', opacity=1, width=1, fill='none', origin=[0, 0])

Convert the polygon to an SVG path.

copy()

Create a copy of the polygon.

cut(line, decals=None)

Cut the polygon by a given line.

Parameters:

  • line (Line) – Cutting line (can be MultiLine).

  • decals (list[Number] | None) – Optional offsets. Expected length = polygon edges + line segments - 1.

Returns:

  • List of new Polygon objects created by the cut.

  • List of offset lists (decals) per polygon.

  • List of intersection points if only partial cut, else None.

Return type:

tuple

classmethod from_multiline(multiline)

Convert the MultiLine to a Polygon.

n_points: int = 0

class origami_tools.Geometry.surface.Surface(points)

Get the lines of the surface.

in_2D(repere=None)
in_3D()
normal_vect()

Compute an average normal vector for a polygon.

Works for convex and non-convex polygons, assuming approximate planarity.

Return type:

Vec

offset(d)

Offset the surface by displacing each edge perpendicularly within the plane. Positive values shrink the shape, negative values expand it.

triangulate()

Triangulate the surface.

A class representing a line defined by two points.

angles_with(other, intersection=None)

Compute the two possible angles between self and another Line.

If an intersection point is provided, the direction vectors are aligned accordingly so that angles are oriented from the intersection. This helps determine the ‘left’ and ‘right’ angular difference around the intersection.

Returns two angles in radians, always in the range [0, 2π).

Return type:

list[float | int]

class origami_tools.Geometry.Polygon(points, n_points=0)

Bases: Surface

A class representing a polygon defined by its vertices.

as_svg(color='black', opacity=1, width=1, fill='none', origin=[0, 0])

Convert the polygon to an SVG path.

copy()

Create a copy of the polygon.

cut(line, decals=None)

Cut the polygon by a given line.

Parameters:

  • line (Line) – Cutting line (can be MultiLine).

  • decals (list[Number] | None) – Optional offsets. Expected length = polygon edges + line segments - 1.

Returns:

  • List of new Polygon objects created by the cut.

  • List of offset lists (decals) per polygon.

  • List of intersection points if only partial cut, else None.

Return type:

tuple
